citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A black and white Boston Terrier (#1047) had a loose upper premolar on the right side of its mouth. In addition a black
and white female Boston Terrier (#789) had hair loss around its neck and legs. The skin was also reddened. The licensee
noticed a week ago but has not initiated treatment.
Dental issues can be painful and can lead to systemic disease and even death. Hair loss and reddened skin indicates
there may be an underlying health issue with the dog that may be contagious to other dogs. The skin may be itchy and
irritating to the dog. Both dogs need to be evaluated and treated by the Attending Veterinarian.
Correct by 7/27/23.

Five seven-week old puppies were in an enclosure that measured 48 X 24 inches for a total floor space of 1,152 square
inches of space. The puppies measured 10.5 inches, 10.5 inches, 11 inches, 11 inches, and 11.5 inches. Together they
required 1,428.75 square inches of space so the enclosure was short by 276.25 square inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 7/24/23.
Note: The licensee corrected this at the time of inspection.

The licensee has not been testing (sampling) his adult population for heartworm or fecal parasites. Not sampling the adult
dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adults dogs
must be sampled for heartworm and fecal parasites in accordance with a plan from their Attending Veterinarian. Correct
by 8/24/23.

The licensee stated all the adult dogs have been vaccinated for parvo and distemper in the past year, but he does not
have this documented anywhere. Not keeping proper medical records showing documentation of which vaccines were
given and the dates they were given doesn't ensure the dogs are properly protected against the various diseases those
vaccines are supposed to protect against. The licensee must keep records showing the vaccine type that was given and
the date it was given for all dogs in the kennel.
Correct starting on 7/24/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A black and white Boston Terrier (#1047) had a loose upper premolar on the right side of its mouth. In addition a black 
and white female Boston Terrier (#789) had hair loss around its neck and legs. The skin was also reddened. The licensee 
noticed a week ago but has not initiated treatment. 
 
Dental issues can be painful and can lead to systemic disease and even death. Hair loss and reddened skin indicates 
there may be an underlying health issue with the dog that may be contagious to other dogs. The skin may be itchy and 
irritating to the dog. Both dogs need to be evaluated and treated by the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
Correct by 7/27/23. 
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Five seven-week old puppies were in an enclosure that measured 48 X 24 inches for a total floor space of 1,152 square 
inches of space. The puppies measured 10.5 inches, 10.5 inches, 11 inches, 11 inches, and 11.5 inches. Together they 
required 1,428.75 square inches of space so the enclosure was short by 276.25 square inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 7/24/23. 
 
Note: The licensee corrected this at the time of inspection. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

The licensee has not been testing (sampling) his adult population for heartworm or fecal parasites. Not sampling the adult 
dogs for parasites doesn't ensure the dogs are adequately protected from various diseases and parasites. All adults dogs 
must be sampled for heartworm and fecal parasites in accordance with a plan from their Attending Veterinarian. Correct 
by 8/24/23. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee stated all the adult dogs have been vaccinated for parvo and distemper in the past year, but he does not 
have this documented anywhere. Not keeping proper medical records showing documentation of which vaccines were 
given and the dates they were given doesn't ensure the dogs are properly protected against the various diseases those 
vaccines are supposed to protect against. The licensee must keep records showing the vaccine type that was given and 
the date it was given for all dogs in the kennel.  
 Correct starting on 7/24/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Jennifer Walker, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
